content:
• Monday, May 21, 2012
  • ORI

    Property insurer Old Republic (NYSE:ORI) announces a partial leveraged buyout and planned...

    Property insurer Old Republic (NYSE:ORI) announces a partial leveraged buyout and planned spinoff of its Republic Financial Indemnity Group's stock which will establish RFIG as a separate publicly-held company. ORI +5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • NDSN

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ2 EPS of $0.84 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $315M (+14% Y/Y) misses by...

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN): FQ2 EPS of $0.84 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $315M (+14% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares +4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • ZBRA

    Zebra Technologies (ZBRA -2.9%) finishes lower after being downgraded to Neutral earlier today...

    Zebra Technologies (ZBRA -2.9%) finishes lower after being downgraded to Neutral earlier today at JPMorgan. The firm says hardware sales will be negatively impacted by moderating enterprise IT investment spending. The firm also lowers its price target lowered to $41 from $44.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $569M (+9% Y/Y)...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $569M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ENVI

    Though it sold off from the day's highs, Envivio (ENVI +3.8%) closed with a decent gain after...

    Though it sold off from the day's highs, Envivio (ENVI +3.8%) closed with a decent gain after underwriters launched coverage with bullish ratings. Stifel thinks the TV Everywhere hardware/software vendor will see its addressable market grow at a 34% CAGR through 2015 with the help of new products, and Goldman argues deals with Time Warner Cable, Verizon, and Cablevision validate Envivio's technology lead.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • SM

    Moody's raises its outlook on SM Energy (SM +6.7%) to positive from stable, citing increased...

    Moody's raises its outlook on SM Energy (SM +6.7%) to positive from stable, citing increased production scale and low borrowing levels. Moody's still rates SM at Ba3, three notches below investment grade, but says it could raise SM by a notch in 2013 if it sees increases in reserves and production scale, better investment returns and continued low leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.9%), which had 60.3% of its float shorted as of April 30, is...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +7.9%), which had 60.3% of its float shorted as of April 30, is finishing up strongly. Possibly helping is the company's announcement it has filed for a restraining order and injunction to prevent a former distributor from allegedly counterfeiting its products. Ubiquiti also accuses the distributor of spreading false rumors - likely a reference to a Chinese report CEO Robert Pera was relying on mafia ties to crush competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +5.1%) push higher after the company lands a deal with retailer Dollar...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +5.1%) push higher after the company lands a deal with retailer Dollar Tree that will help it expand its network of prepaid banking cards. The company expects to launch its portfolio of products at Dollar Tree stores in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • GRH

    GreenHunter Energy (GRH +20.4%) significantly expands its Eagle Ford Shale presence with a new...

    GreenHunter Energy (GRH +20.4%) significantly expands its Eagle Ford Shale presence with a new JV agreement to develop seven salt water disposal wells in south Texas. GRH says the new wells will establish it as the dominant operator of SWD capacity and a leading provider of water management solutions in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • GPI

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +3%) trades higher after Sterne Agee upgraded the shares to Buy on...

    Group 1 Automotive (GPI +3%) trades higher after Sterne Agee upgraded the shares to Buy on valuation, citing expectations for a modest recovery in U.S. vehicle demand, and higher earnings estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • PG

    Shares of Pursuit Dynamics fell 79% in London trading after Procter & Gamble (PG -0.4%) passed...

    Shares of Pursuit Dynamics fell 79% in London trading after Procter & Gamble (PG -0.4%) passed on signing a licensing agreement to use the firm's fluid-processing technologies for mixing products such as toothpaste - effectively ending a development agreement the two companies originally launched in 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • MLM

    The sharp pullback in shares of Martin Marietta (MLM +1%) and Vulcan (VMC +3.5%) since February...

    The sharp pullback in shares of Martin Marietta (MLM +1%) and Vulcan (VMC +3.5%) since February is overdone, KeyBanc says in upgrading each stock to Buy from Hold. On MLM, the firm thinks industry structure remains favorable, reflecting price power on a locally sourced and shipped product. On VMC, the firm sees a "nascent recovery" in its cyclically depressed aggregates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Technologies (MLNX +8.1%), which soared last month thanks to a giant Q1 beat and strong...

    Mellanox Technologies (MLNX +8.1%), which soared last month thanks to a giant Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance, jumps again after announcing its InfiniBand and 10G/40G Ethernet modules are available for use with H-P's ProLiant Generation 8 servers. A pickup in sales to H-P, the world's #2 server vendor, would help Mellanox reduce its heavy dependence on Oracle's high-end systems. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +8.1%), crushed a month ago due to a Q1 revenue miss and poor Q2 guidance,...

    Riverbed (RVBD +8.1%), crushed a month ago due to a Q1 revenue miss and poor Q2 guidance, bounces off its 52-week lows after announcing it's doubling its stock buyback authorization to $300M, of which $237M remains for future purchases. At current levels, that's good for acquiring 9% of all outstanding shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • PVAC

    Coverage of Penn Virginia (PVA +12.9%) is started at Brean Murray with a Buy rating and a $10...

    Coverage of Penn Virginia (PVA +12.9%) is started at Brean Murray with a Buy rating and a $10 price target, as the firm says proceeds from the company's anticipated Granite Wash divestiture should shift market focus from liquidity concerns to the value of its Eagle Ford acreage.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • CROX

    Shares of a number of shoe-sellling companies jump higher after Friday's double-dose of positive...

    Shares of a number of shoe-sellling companies jump higher after Friday's double-dose of positive earnings reports from Foot Locker and Brown Shoe shine a brighter spotlight on the sector. Could troubles at Sears Holdings and J.C. Penney's be partially behind the sudden resurgence of mall-based shoe outlets? Advancers: CROX +5.5%, DECK +4.1%, SHOO +2.6%, SKX +3%, KSWS +5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • KCP

    Bandera Partners, a large shareholder in Kenneth Cole Productions (KCP +2.2%), calls the buyout...

    Bandera Partners, a large shareholder in Kenneth Cole Productions (KCP +2.2%), calls the buyout offer from founder Kenneth Cole too low. Bandera disclosed that it owns 5.7% of Kenneth Cole shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +11.5%) bounce back off of recent 52-week lows as investors show...

    Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +11.5%) bounce back off of recent 52-week lows as investors show the biggest boost of confidence in the name since Green Mountain Cofee Roaster's Q1 debacle sparked a major selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CLNE

    SA author Kevin Quon highlights 5 firms that are prospering from low natural gas prices,...

    SA author Kevin Quon highlights 5 firms that are prospering from low natural gas prices, including those that benefit from the use of gas as a fuel source and those that make it readily available. The five are Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +7.55%), Fuel Systems (FSYS +2.9%), Golar LNG (GLNG +3.6%), Chart Industries (GTLS +5.3%) and Westport (WPRT +11.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 11 Comments
  • TORM

    TOR Minerals (TORM +7.4%) trades up after saying it has received a purchase order from a major...

    TOR Minerals (TORM +7.4%) trades up after saying it has received a purchase order from a major international chemical customer to supply $11M in synthetic rutile titanium dioxide feedstock. TORM expects to ship and recognize revenue for the entire transaction late during Q212.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC +2.8%) follows the tech sector higher after 5.5% activist shareholder Elliott...

    BMC Software (BMC +2.8%) follows the tech sector higher after 5.5% activist shareholder Elliott Associates issues a PR questioning recent comments from BMC about the health of its business, and the company responds with a short PR defending its remarks. BMC rallied a week ago on news of Elliott's stake in the company, even though it adopted a poison pill in response.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • MCOX

    Mecox Lane (MCOX +9.4%), which operates one of China's leading online platforms for apparel...

    Mecox Lane (MCOX +9.4%), which operates one of China's leading online platforms for apparel and accessories, says its board of directors has approved a $10M ADR repurchase program.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • HAST

    Shares of Hastings Entertainment (NASDAQ:HAST) run up a 17.8% gain after the firm reports a...

    Shares of Hastings Entertainment (NASDAQ:HAST) run up a 17.8% gain after the firm reports a profit in FQ1 after analysts were calling for a small loss. Though revenue and same-store sales tailed off on a Y/Y comparison, the company showed strong double-digit growth in its Electronics and Trends segment for the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +9.8%) and Tudou (TUDO +10.1%), whose planned merger will create a Chinese...

    Youku.com (YOKU +9.8%) and Tudou (TUDO +10.1%), whose planned merger will create a Chinese online video giant, rally strongly following Tudou's Q1 beat. Tudou's revenue surged thanks to a 63% Y/Y increase in online ad sales, and a 53% increase in mobile service sales. However, in a sign monetization may be lagging traffic growth, bandwidth costs amounted to 51% of revenue, up from 39% in the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • FEIC

    Stifel Nicolaus says recent channel checks indicate that FEI's (FEIC +1%) fundamental picture...

    Stifel Nicolaus says recent channel checks indicate that FEI's (FEIC +1%) fundamental picture hasn't changed, so the recent decline in the company's stock creates a good buying opportunity. The firm maintains a $58 target and Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • MGM

    Toronto could be the next gambling mecca after officials in Ontario started the process of...

    Toronto could be the next gambling mecca after officials in Ontario started the process of clearing a path for the development of a hotel-casino complex. MGM Resorts (MGM +2.1%) and Caesars Entertainment (CZR +0.1%) are already meeting with city officials, while Las Vegas Sands (LVS +2.1%) reportedly sent execs to the city on a scouting mission.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • SWY

    Safeway (SWY +2.3%) moves up on an upgraded to Buy on valuation at Citigroup. The firm cites...

    Safeway (SWY +2.3%) moves up on an upgraded to Buy on valuation at Citigroup. The firm cites growth potential from the companys recent promotions and improved cost discipline. The firm raised ups its price target to $26 from $22.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • NGL

    NGL Energy Partners (NGL +10.9%) acquires crude oil transportation and water treatment...

    NGL Energy Partners (NGL +10.9%) acquires crude oil transportation and water treatment services from in High Sierra Energy in a $693M deal. High Sierra's crude oil segment handles ~50K bbl/day of crude and controls 32 pipeline injection facilities and three crude oil terminals; its water services segment handles ~80K bbl of water per day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +3.8%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink Swann, saying believes...

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +3.8%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink Swann, saying believes concerns over the company's reimbursement risk and intellectual property are overdone and that the drug developers product lines are continuing to grow. The firm also raised its price target range to $30 - $31 from $27 - $30.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +6.5%) is one of today's top S&P gainers after Guggenheim upgrades...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +6.5%) is one of today's top S&P gainers after Guggenheim upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral, "first and foremost" a valuation call. "Improving U.S. gas market fundamentals and expanding international margins [may] prompt investors to consider how oversold the stock has become" relative to its underlying asset value and strong cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • ENLK

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) +4.1%, possibly due to BrightonMarkets releasing new coverage on the...

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) +4.1%, possibly due to BrightonMarkets releasing new coverage on the stock. The firm says that despite concerns about volatility in 2012, it "continues to identify high momentum situations with growth potential." Forbes argued last week that Crosstex was "very oversold."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • GRPN

    Off in early trading in sympathy with Facebook, Groupon (GRPN +7.4%) is now up sharply, and has...

    Off in early trading in sympathy with Facebook, Groupon (GRPN +7.4%) is now up sharply, and has recouped most of Friday's losses. At $12.44, shares remain well below the company's IPO price of $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +4.1%) bounces off multi-year lows with the help of a bullish Wells Fargo note....

    Polycom (PLCM +4.1%) bounces off multi-year lows with the help of a bullish Wells Fargo note. The firm argues the impact of Polycom's recent CFO transition should be minimal, and that the company's financial health is strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM +3.4%) shares could rise 50%, Barron's Robin Blumenthal believes, ahead of a...

    Newmont Mining (NEM +3.4%) shares could rise 50%, Barron's Robin Blumenthal believes, ahead of a potential rise in gold prices. Gold has historically outperformed gold mining stocks, but the ratio between the two is at an all-time high - an opportunity for investors, given Europe's troubles and the Fed's willingness to keep printing money to stoke the weak U.S. economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • ENVI

    Envivio (ENVI +5.9%) gains on a trio of initiations this morning, as Goldman, Deutsche and...

    Envivio (ENVI +5.9%) gains on a trio of initiations this morning, as Goldman, Deutsche and Stifel Nicolaus all start coverage with with a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • EADSY

    EADS (OTCPK:EADSY +0.7%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS on the back its solid Q1...

    EADS (OTCPK:EADSY +0.7%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS on the back its solid Q1 earnings result last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • AAPL

    Piper's Gene Munster declares there's an 80% chance Apple (AAPL +3.4%) will hit his sales...

    Piper's Gene Munster declares there's an 80% chance Apple (AAPL +3.4%) will hit his sales forecasts for the next-gen iPhone, in spite of Qualcomm's (NASDAQ:QCOM) 28nm chip supply issues. In typical form, Munster adds the next iPhone will trigger the biggest "upgrade cycle in smartphone history." Meanwhile, Jefferies' Peter Misek predicts Apple will lower the unsubsidized price of the iPhone 3GS to $250-$300, to help it better compete with Android in emerging markets. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • ACHN

    Achillion (ACHN +10.4%), possibly because of the release of positive results from a Phase Ib...

    Achillion (ACHN +10.4%), possibly because of the release of positive results from a Phase Ib trial of ACH-2684 for the Treatment of Hepatitis C. Last week, the FDA fast-tracked ACH-3102, also for Hepatitis C. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • ETN

    Eaton (ETN +1%) is paying about 14X EBITDA for Cooper (CBE +26%), Bloomberg calculates, in a...

    Eaton (ETN +1%) is paying about 14X EBITDA for Cooper (CBE +26%), Bloomberg calculates, in a deal that Eaton shareholder CAIM calls "pretty amazing," as "they're going to dominate that electrical power equipment segment," especially when the economy improves. The purchase is also sending shares of Hubbell (HUB.A) +6.3% and Accuity (AYI +5.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +1.5%) spike higher before settling back a bit after chatter kicks...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +1.5%) spike higher before settling back a bit after chatter kicks up that Oaktree Capital may make an investment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGC

    Shares of Regal Entertainment (RGC +2.9%) and Cinemark Holdings (CNK +2.2%) trade higher in the...

    Shares of Regal Entertainment (RGC +2.9%) and Cinemark Holdings (CNK +2.2%) trade higher in the wake of a mega-deal by China's Wanda Group to buy AMC Entertainment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.4%) shares are up on news that CEO Harold Hamm bought 100K shares...

    Continental Resources (CLR +3.4%) shares are up on news that CEO Harold Hamm bought 100K shares of the company on May 16 at $71-$72.50, worth ~$7.2M. Following the purchases, Hamm holds an aggregate of more than 123M shares directly.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +5.7%) gets a lift from an upgrade by Longbow Research to Buy from Neutral....

    Supervalu (SVU +5.7%) gets a lift from an upgrade by Longbow Research to Buy from Neutral. Analysts with the firm also boost their price target on shares to $8 - repping 64% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +11%) surges after Canaccord calls it a takeover candidate. The firm...

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +11%) surges after Canaccord calls it a takeover candidate. The firm believes GDP's 103K net acre Tuscaloosa leasehold is too large for the company to develop alone given its current capitalization; a larger entity could buy GDP in its entirety or the company could enter into a JV and issue equity to fund Tuscaloosa's development.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -13.2%) tumbles in early trading to $33.20; even after the selloff, the company...

    Facebook (FB -13.2%) tumbles in early trading to $33.20; even after the selloff, the company trades at nearly 23x sales and 75x trailing EPS. Not helping is BTIG's decision to launch coverage at Neutral; in-line with earlier comments, the firm is worried about Facebook's valuation, decelerating growth, and ad monetization issues. Also lower: RENN -8.3%. ZNGA -7.1%. YELP -6.8%. LNKD -6.1%. GRPN -4.8%. SVVC -7.4%. GSVC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 16 Comments
  • TDW

    Tidewater (TDW +2.8%) shares jump at the open after reporting FQ4 earnings soared Y/Y, helped by...

    Tidewater (TDW +2.8%) shares jump at the open after reporting FQ4 earnings soared Y/Y, helped by higher utilization and rates for the company's vessels. TDW had being seeing growing expenses such as high-priced fuel and interest costs pressure its bottom line. Operating margin grew to 16.1% from 9.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • ETN

    More on Eaton (ETN +1.2%) / Cooper (CBE +24.8%) deal: Eaton's offer of $72 a share represents a...

    More on Eaton (ETN +1.2%) / Cooper (CBE +24.8%) deal: Eaton's offer of $72 a share represents a 29% premium on Cooper's close on Friday. The deal is expected to generate ~$535M in annual synergies by 2016, and be accretive to operating EPS by $0.35 in 2014 and $0.45 in 2015. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • JMBA

    Shares of Jamba Juice (NASDAQ:JMBA) jump 12% in premarket trading after the company lifts its...

    Shares of Jamba Juice (NASDAQ:JMBA) jump 12% in premarket trading after the company lifts its comparable-store sales guidance for FY12 to 4%-6%, from a previous range of 3%-4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • ETN

    Global power manager Eaton (NYSE:ETN) will buy Cooper Industries (CBE up 25% premarket) for...

    Global power manager Eaton (NYSE:ETN) will buy Cooper Industries (CBE up 25% premarket) for $72/share in cash and stock and become a new company incorporated in Ireland: Eaton Global Corp. The whole deal has a value of $11.8B and should close in the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are higher along with much of Europe, although not France and...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are higher along with much of Europe, although not France and Spain, with the S&P benchmark +0.6%. Platitudes from the G8 that they want Greece to stay in the euro and polls showing increasing support for pro-austerity parties seem to be doing the trick. Yahoo is +4.4% on its Alibaba deal, but Facebook is -3.8% and below its IPO price, while Lowe's is -5.5% after a profit warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • ETN

    Premarket gainers: CBE +25%. JMBA +12%. RDN +8%. VELT +6%. Losers: RENN -9%. LOW -6%.

    Premarket gainers: CBE +25%. JMBA +12%. RDN +8%. VELT +6%.
    Losers: RENN -9%. LOW -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) is raised to Buy from Hold with a $15 price target at Brean...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) is raised to Buy from Hold with a $15 price target at Brean Murray, citing valuation: "The fundamentals and the outlook of the company and the met coal market did not materially change over recent weeks. What did change is the stock price." Shares, -46% YTD, +2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) jump 2.2% premarket after peer Smith & Wesson (SWHC) reports...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) jump 2.2% premarket after peer Smith & Wesson (SWHC) reports strong sales in its most recent quarter along with a growing backlog of orders. SWHC +13.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 5 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) +1.3% premarket after Argus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an $85 target...

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) +1.3% premarket after Argus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an $85 target price. The firm cites favorable trends helping BA: commercial flight demand continues to recover, airlines are eager to replace aging aircraft with more fuel-efficient planes, and BA's strong international and commercial market sales help insulate it from cuts in U.S. defense spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) +22.7% premarket after announcing positive top-line results...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) +22.7% premarket after announcing positive top-line results from a Phase IIb trial of its bavituximab lung cancer treatment. Data showed a doubling of overall response rates and an improvement in progression-free survival in patients receiving the treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • BGC

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) agrees to acquire Alcan Cable, the wire and cable business of Rio Tinto...

    General Cable (NYSE:BGC) agrees to acquire Alcan Cable, the wire and cable business of Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO), for $185M in cash. BGC says it expects to use its revolving credit facility to principally fund the transaction. BGC +0.7%, RIO +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) falls through $38 in premarket trade, -2.7% to $37.20. Have the...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) falls through $38 in premarket trade, -2.7% to $37.20. Have the underwriters - who unleashed incredible firepower to hold $38 on Friday - gotten to their desks yet?

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 9 Comments
  • AOBC

    Guns are selling like hotcakes: Smith & Wesson (SWHC) announces preliminary results for FQ4,...

    Guns are selling like hotcakes: Smith & Wesson (SWHC) announces preliminary results for FQ4, saying sales were up 28% Y/Y to $129M - higher than the firm's guidance calling for $113M-$118M. Preliminary firearm order backlog increased 135% Y/Y and 121% Q/Q to approximately $439M. Shares +5.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 4 Comments
  • CPB

    Shares of Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) trail off 1.8% premarket after the company says in its FQ3...

    Shares of Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) trail off 1.8% premarket after the company says in its FQ3 report that it didn't execute well in some categories and only reconfirms FY12 EPS of $2.35-$2.42 on the strength of a favorable tax rate. The company saw flat revenue Y/Y, impacted positively 3% from price and sales allowances, while promotional spending clipped 2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • AVP

    Shares of Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) fall 5.1% premarket as analysts highlight the mounting...

    Shares of Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) fall 5.1% premarket as analysts highlight the mounting challenges CEO Sheri McCoy has in front of her. Stifel Nicolaus' Mark Astrachan doesn't see a quick fix for the company, noting the company needs to do a biting top-to-bottom assessment of its markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • LOW

    Shares of Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) slip 3.1% in premarket trading after the company's tepid guidance...

    Shares of Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) slip 3.1% in premarket trading after the company's tepid guidance overrides its Q1 earnings beat. CEO Robert Niblock says that although mild weather drove sales higher, demand for seasonal products trended slower near the end of the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM
